subject: Re: USAC Circuits
body:
Allen,
I understand.  You can't take on that liability when you don't have answers or a way out.  Let's stay in touch and I'm happy to help anyway we can.  We do a bunch of things outside of USAC if we can help.  Manage services and hosted phone systems are our specialty. If we can do anything for you buddy let us know.

Thanks,



Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

1710 General George Patton Dr, Suite 104

Brentwood, TN 37027

www.chargeraccess.com<http://www.chargeraccess.com>

________________________________
From: Allen Roberts <aroberts@sscsb.org>
Sent: Friday, June 26, 2020 6:32:26 PM
To: Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com>
Subject: Re: USAC Circuits

Mike thanks for checking in. Unfortunately we being a nonprofit can’t afford to buy out our remaining 24 month contract that was upwards 1.2 million.  I’ll personally be reaching out to you when it ends with the hope you guys will still be interested in submitting a proposal.

Allen

Sent from my iPhone

On Jun 26, 2020, at 12:11 PM, Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com<mailto:michael@chargeraccess.com>> wrote:

﻿

Allen,

I wanted to check in before the weekend to see how things were going.  Have you guys made your decision?  Regardless of if you select us to partner with we would advise you to get the 466 submitted by Monday in case there are any hiccups.  If you do select us we are happy to set a call and help you complete the form.



Have a great weekend,





Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

1710 General George Patton Dr, Suite 104 

Brentwood, TN 37027

www.chargeraccess.com<http://www.chargeraccess.com/>

<image001.png>

subject: Re: USAC contact
body:
I sent you a couple emails yesterday with multiple HCP in each.  If you want to disregard those I can resend in that format.  Also, would you like each HCP in a separate email?

Thanks,



Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

1710 General George Patton Dr, Suite 104

Brentwood, TN 37027

www.chargeraccess.com<http://www.chargeraccess.com>

________________________________
From: David Wagner <david@pemfilings.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 14, 2020 7:01:00 AM
To: Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com>
Subject: RE: USAC contact


This is a great way to request, with HCP#, and application #, in case an HCP has multiple ones.  Also, the site name allows confirming so typo’s do not cause error.



HCP 16992 Ellerbe Family Care Center App #100036693



From: Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com>
Sent: Monday, January 13, 2020 4:42 PM
To: David Wagner <david@pemfilings.com>
Subject: USAC contact



Hey David,



I tried to call you and just left a message but I know it’s a busy time of year.  I’m going to handling Tennessee and the surrounding states this year for Charger Access.  We are interested in bidding on a bunch of the RFPs you have posted so far and ones to come.  What’s the best way to get more info on each posting?  I want find out things like if they are out of contract this year and see if there is specific speeds they are looking for.  Is it best for me to make a list and call you once a week or so or send an email with the ones I’m looking at?  You have so many I just want to take the most efficient path for you.



Thanks,



Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

1710 General George Patton Dr, Suite 104 

Brentwood, TN 37027

www.chargeraccess.com<http://www.chargeraccess.com/>

[cid:32FF1FCD-7585-4E80-8094-A525689A2B37]

subject: Re: USAC Funding
body:
No problem.  Let me know when you guys are ready and we will make it happen.

Get Outlook for Android<https://aka.ms/AAb9ysg>
________________________________
From: Richard French <rfrench@vbhcs.org>
Sent: Thursday, January 27, 2022 5:56:35 PM
To: Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com>
Subject: RE: USAC Funding


Mike, thanks for getting back to me so quickly.  We actually have CARF accreditation going on this next week, so we will likely need to look beyond this coming week.  Let me check with folks at Volunteer to see what their schedules look like for the week of Feb 7th.  Thanks for being willing to talk.



Richard E. French

Senior VP

Volunteer Behavioral Health Care System

731-571-3399

the intended recipient(s) and may include VOLUNTEER BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE SYSTEM
client(s) information that is legally privileged.  Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or
distribution is prohibited.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by
replying to e?mail and destroy copies of the original message.



From: Michael Hyams<mailto:michael@chargeraccess.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 27, 2022 5:27 PM
To: Richard French<mailto:rfrench@vbhcs.org>
Subject: RE: USAC Funding



How about Wednesday at 11am Central?



Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

206 Gothic Ct, Suite 304

Franklin, TN 37067

www.chargeraccess.com<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__www.chargeraccess.com&d=DwQGaQ&c=euGZstcaTDllvimEN8b7jXrwqOf-v5A_CdpgnVfiiMM&r=r-AqC0hTn-fcTngnP5bO1kBvby58avWr2CZgd6BAyAc&m=KUeaGf-G-y3NYQkSjdTp-RBZe4HkpEWrc_LsH-Jz80U&s=cxoDOjjDYjjlPfxcOgqEwZ15OZM8mS9SQkmUnA4EUgU&e=>

[cid:<image001.png@01D813A3.208A6F50>]



From: Richard French <rfrench@vbhcs.org>
Sent: Thursday, January 27, 2022 5:22 PM
To: Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com>
Subject: USAC Funding



Michael, though I am now at Volunteer Behavioral Health in middle Tn, for the prior 35 years I had been the Fiscal Director at Carey Counseling Center in Paris, Tn.  I recall that over the years we had quite a bit of success in obtaining USAC funding to help offset the cost of our phone lines, and I recall in recent years that folks at Charger Access worked with Jasen Orlovich on providing info as to how Carey needed to go about that application process.  Would you mind taking a few minutes someday to have a call with me and some other folks at Volunteer to discuss whether Volunteer might potentially qualify for USAC funding.  Volunteer covers 30+ counties, some of which are rural and some (like the Chattanooga area) are not so rural.  I will be upfront with you in that I think Volunteer is happy with their current internet/phone line provider, but you never know where conversations today might lead to down the road.



Richard E. French

Senior VP

Volunteer Behavioral Health Care System

731-571-3399



Confidentiality Notice: This e?mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of

client(s) information that is legally privileged.  Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or
distribution is prohibited.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by
replying to e?mail and destroy copies of the original message.

From: Chip Tarbutton <CTarbutton@nrvcs.org>
Sent: Friday, March 27, 2020 8:24:08 AM
To: Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com>
Subject: RE: USAC Telecom


Just so you know, USAC has been asking a lot of questions about our 465 filing. Typically the 465 has been a formality. This year it is proving not to be… I have responded back to several inquiries already, which is likely why the document has not posted as of yet.

Sent: Monday, March 23, 2020 3:27 PM

Mike Hyams

Brentwood, TN 37027

Subject: RE: USAC Telecom



Totally agree. Thursday or Friday are mostly open.



From: Michael Hyams [mailto:michael@chargeraccess.com]
Sent: Monday, March 23, 2020 12:24 PM
To: Chip Tarbutton <CTarbutton@nrvcs.org<mailto:CTarbutton@nrvcs.org>>
Subject: RE: USAC Telecom



Chip,

I hope all is well for you guys.  With everything going on we have decided against any travel.  We like to do proposals in person but looks like conference calls are our new best friend.  I working on about 65 locations in your areas so I was able to get approval for special pricing.  I should have it all sorted out in the next day or so.  First could you let me know which of you locations are not classified as rural.  Also, what would be a good time this week to share with you our plan?



Thanks,



Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

1710 General George Patton Dr, Suite 104 

Brentwood, TN 37027

www.chargeraccess.com<http://www.chargeraccess.com/>

[cid:32FF1FCD-7585-4E80-8094-A525689A2B37]

To: Michael Hyams <michael@chargeraccess.com<mailto:michael@chargeraccess.com>>
Subject: RE: USAC Telecom



Thanks for reminding me. It has been a real nightmare the last couple of days preparing for the worst….although we have a pretty robust DR plan so it will be worth it if it works and it will be the best drill we could have possibly done.

Sent: Friday, March 13, 2020 10:48 AM
To: Chip Tarbutton <CTarbutton@nrvcs.org<mailto:CTarbutton@nrvcs.org>>
Subject: RE: USAC Telecom



I’m following up on our conversation from yesterday.  You were going to send me a spreadsheet with you locations and speeds.  I’m definitely not trying to rush you, it just sounded like you we in the process of sending it while we were on the phone.  I know you are busy just thought I would check in just in case you did send it and I didn’t get it.  Have a great weekend.



Mike Hyams

1710 General George Patton Dr, Suite 104 

Brentwood, TN 37027

subject: USAC 465 posting
body:
Danae,
I saw your request for service on the USAC site.  I wanted to learn more about your needs so we could put together a bid.  Do you have an RFP you could send me or could we get on a call to talk about your organization?  Looking forward to hearing from you.

Thanks,

Mike Hyams
Charger Access, LLC
615-622-4603 Office
206 Gothic Ct, Suite 304
Franklin, TN 37067
www.chargeraccess.com<http://www.chargeraccess.com/>
[cid:image001.png@01DA5368.ABCFFDD0]

subject: USAC 465
body:
Elizabeth,

 

I hope this message finds you well. My name is Mike, and I am with Charger Access. I am writing to express our interest in bidding on your recent USAC Request for Service.

 

We are very interested in learning more about your company, your specific needs, and how we can best support your initiatives through our services.  We actually have a customer not far from you that we were able to help a few years ago.

 

Would it be possible to schedule a call at your convenience to discuss this further? Please let me know a time that works for you, or feel free to suggest an alternative contact if that is preferable.

 

Thank you for considering our inquiry. I look forward to the opportunity to speak with you soon.

 

Best regards,

 

 

Thanks,

 

Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

206 Gothic Ct, Suite 304

Franklin, TN 37067

www.chargeraccess.com <http://www.chargeraccess.com/>

subject: USAC Bid
body:
Here is our bid.  You will see a BRP payment on the bid whick will be you required monthly payment.  We basically let you pay the after-funding rate from day one as opposed to waiting for the funding to come in from USAC.  I will be out of the country next week, but I will be checking emails when I can.  Let me know if you have any questions.


Thanks,



Mike Hyams

Charger Access, LLC

615-622-4603 Office

206 Gothic Ct, Suite 304

Franklin, TN 37067

www.chargeraccess.com<http://www.chargeraccess.com/>

[cid:8318b37b-434f-40d6-8f41-96dd092578a3]

subject: USAC Telecom
body:
